title: Special prison will be built for drug addict inmates: Home adviser
body: Home Affairs Adviser Lt Gen (retd) Md Jahangir Alam Chowdhury today said a separate special prison will be established for drug addicts, where an arrangement will be made for them to earn a livelihood. Talking to journalists after inspecting the Narsingdi District Jail, he said he had found that most of the inmates are drug users. "Drugs have no benefit. We will raise public awareness about the dangers of drug abuse," he added. "The quality of food provided to inmates has improved compared to before," he said. The adviser said, in Narsigdi's Raipura upazila, incidents of murder and clashes take place frequently. "Criminals are freely committing crimes, including killings. There are many criminal hideouts and a large presence of illegal weapons," he added. He said a combing operation involving the army, police, Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), and others will be launched soon to bring these criminals to book. He further said a crackdown will be intensified to recover the weapons looted from the district jail during the July uprising. "A significant number of weapons went missing from the jail, and there is no scope to deny it," he added. Earlier, the adviser planted a tree on the district police lines premises and inspected the police lines hospital. Narsingdi Deputy Commissioner Mohammad Anwar Hossain, Superintendent of Police Abdullah Al-Faruq, and other senior officials were present at the time.
